prefix_walkthrough:
!!! Here is a walkthrough of a text game:

==>STEP NUM: 0
==>ACT: Init
==>OBSERVATION: Welcome to Adventure!
(Please type HELP for instructions and information.)


ADVENTURE
The Interactive Original
By Will Crowther (1976) and Don Woods (1977)
Reconstructed in three steps by:
Donald Ekman, David M. Baggett (1993) and Graham Nelson (1994)
[In memoriam Stephen Bishop (1820?-1857): GN]

Release 9 / Serial number 060321 / Inform v6.31 Library 6/11 S

At End Of Road
You are standing at the end of a road before a small brick building. Around you is a forest. A small stream flows out of the building and down a gully.


==>STEP NUM: 1
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Inside Building
You are inside a building, a well house for a large spring.

There are some keys on the ground here.

There is tasty food here.

There is a shiny brass lamp nearby.

There is an empty bottle here.


==>STEP NUM: 2
==>ACT: get all
==>OBSERVATION: set of keys: Taken.
tasty food: Taken.
brass lantern: Taken.
small bottle: Taken.
stream: The bottle is now full of water.
well house: That's hardly portable.
spring: That's hardly portable.
pair of 1 foot diameter sewer pipes: That's hardly portable.


==>STEP NUM: 3
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: At End Of Road


==>STEP NUM: 4
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: In A Valley
You are in a valley in the forest beside a stream tumbling along a rocky bed.


==>STEP NUM: 5
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: At Slit In Streambed
At your feet all the water of the stream splashes into a 2-inch slit in the rock. Downstream the streambed is bare rock.


==>STEP NUM: 6
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Outside Grate
You are in a 20-foot depression floored with bare dirt. Set into the dirt is a strong steel grate mounted in concrete. A dry streambed leads into the depression.


==>STEP NUM: 7
==>ACT: unlock grate with keys
==>OBSERVATION: You unlock the steel grate.


==>STEP NUM: 8
==>ACT: open grate
==>OBSERVATION: You open the steel grate.


==>STEP NUM: 9
==>ACT: down
==>OBSERVATION: Below the Grate
You are in a small chamber beneath a 3x3 steel grate to the surface. A low crawl over cobbles leads inward to the west.

The grate stands open.


==>STEP NUM: 10
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: In Cobble Crawl
You are crawling over cobbles in a low passage. There is a dim light at the east end of the passage.

There is a small wicker cage discarded nearby.


==>STEP NUM: 11
==>ACT: get cage
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 12
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Darkness
It is pitch dark, and you can't see a thing.


==>STEP NUM: 13
==>ACT: light lamp
==>OBSERVATION: You switch the brass lantern on.

In Debris Room
You are in a debris room filled with stuff washed in from the surface. A low wide passage with cobbles becomes plugged with mud and debris here, but an awkward canyon leads upward and west. 

A note on the wall says, "Magic word XYZZY."

A three foot black rod with a rusty star on one end lies nearby.


==>STEP NUM: 14
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Sloping E/W Canyon
You are in an awkward sloping east/west canyon.


==>STEP NUM: 15
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Orange River Chamber
You are in a splendid chamber thirty feet high. The walls are frozen rivers of orange stone. An awkward canyon and a good passage exit from east and west sides of the chamber.

A cheerful little bird is sitting here singing.


==>STEP NUM: 16
==>ACT: get bird
==>OBSERVATION: You catch the bird in the wicker cage.


==>STEP NUM: 17
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: At Top of Small Pit
At your feet is a small pit breathing traces of white mist. A west passage ends here except for a small crack leading on. 

Rough stone steps lead down the pit.


==>STEP NUM: 18
==>ACT: down
==>OBSERVATION: In Hall of Mists
You are at one end of a vast hall stretching forward out of sight to the west. There are openings to either side. Nearby, a wide stone staircase leads downward. The hall is filled with wisps of white mist swaying to and fro almost as if alive. A cold wind blows up the staircase. There is a passage at the top of a dome behind you. 

Rough stone steps lead up the dome.

[Your score has just gone up by twenty-five points.]

raw_response_step_navi:
!!! Here is a walkthrough of a text game:

==>STEP NUM: 0
==>ACT: Init
==>OBSERVATION: Welcome to Adventure!
(Please type HELP for instructions and information.)


ADVENTURE
The Interactive Original
By Will Crowther (1976) and Don Woods (1977)
Reconstructed in three steps by:
Donald Ekman, David M. Baggett (1993) and Graham Nelson (1994)
[In memoriam Stephen Bishop (1820?-1857): GN]

Release 9 / Serial number 060321 / Inform v6.31 Library 6/11 S

At End Of Road
You are standing at the end of a road before a small brick building. Around you is a forest. A small stream flows out of the building and down a gully.


==>STEP NUM: 1
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Inside Building
You are inside a building, a well house for a large spring.

There are some keys on the ground here.

There is tasty food here.

There is a shiny brass lamp nearby.

There is an empty bottle here.


==>STEP NUM: 2
==>ACT: get all
==>OBSERVATION: set of keys: Taken.
tasty food: Taken.
brass lantern: Taken.
small bottle: Taken.
stream: The bottle is now full of water.
well house: That's hardly portable.
spring: That's hardly portable.
pair of 1 foot diameter sewer pipes: That's hardly portable.


==>STEP NUM: 3
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: At End Of Road


==>STEP NUM: 4
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: In A Valley
You are in a valley in the forest beside a stream tumbling along a rocky bed.


==>STEP NUM: 5
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: At Slit In Streambed
At your feet all the water of the stream splashes into a 2-inch slit in the rock. Downstream the streambed is bare rock.


==>STEP NUM: 6
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Outside Grate
You are in a 20-foot depression floored with bare dirt. Set into the dirt is a strong steel grate mounted in concrete. A dry streambed leads into the depression.


==>STEP NUM: 7
==>ACT: unlock grate with keys
==>OBSERVATION: You unlock the steel grate.


==>STEP NUM: 8
==>ACT: open grate
==>OBSERVATION: You open the steel grate.


==>STEP NUM: 9
==>ACT: down
==>OBSERVATION: Below the Grate
You are in a small chamber beneath a 3x3 steel grate to the surface. A low crawl over cobbles leads inward to the west.

The grate stands open.


==>STEP NUM: 10
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: In Cobble Crawl
You are crawling over cobbles in a low passage. There is a dim light at the east end of the passage.

There is a small wicker cage discarded nearby.


==>STEP NUM: 11
==>ACT: get cage
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 12
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Darkness
It is pitch dark, and you can't see a thing.


==>STEP NUM: 13
==>ACT: light lamp
==>OBSERVATION: You switch the brass lantern on.

In Debris Room
You are in a debris room filled with stuff washed in from the surface. A low wide passage with cobbles becomes plugged with mud and debris here, but an awkward canyon leads upward and west. 

A note on the wall says, "Magic word XYZZY."

A three foot black rod with a rusty star on one end lies nearby.


==>STEP NUM: 14
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Sloping E/W Canyon
You are in an awkward sloping east/west canyon.


==>STEP NUM: 15
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Orange River Chamber
You are in a splendid chamber thirty feet high. The walls are frozen rivers of orange stone. An awkward canyon and a good passage exit from east and west sides of the chamber.

A cheerful little bird is sitting here singing.


==>STEP NUM: 16
==>ACT: get bird
==>OBSERVATION: You catch the bird in the wicker cage.


==>STEP NUM: 17
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: At Top of Small Pit
At your feet is a small pit breathing traces of white mist. A west passage ends here except for a small crack leading on. 

Rough stone steps lead down the pit.


==>STEP NUM: 18
==>ACT: down
==>OBSERVATION: In Hall of Mists
You are at one end of a vast hall stretching forward out of sight to the west. There are openings to either side. Nearby, a wide stone staircase leads downward. The hall is filled with wisps of white mist swaying to and fro almost as if alive. A cold wind blows up the staircase. There is a passage at the top of a dome behind you. 

Rough stone steps lead up the dome.

[Your score has just gone up by twenty-five points.]
